Subjective: Headaches 2 months, worsening. Primarily right-sided, sometimes diffuse. Mild nausea, no vomiting. Glare in vision. Aggravated by light/noise; prefers dark room. Initially once, now almost weekly, lasting few days. Paracetamol tried, Ibuprofen worked once. No flashes of light, no recent stress, no coffee/energy drinks. No smoking, occasional alcohol. Family Hx: Father migraines, grandfather cluster headaches. Unable to play volleyball/drink beer on vacation. Student (medicine, 2nd year, 20 y.o.). Request: Dx (migraine/cluster?), best management.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50 bpm. Neurological exam: Cranial nerves fine, fingertip-nose test good, arm/leg strength good, Romberg normal. Gait: Straight line walking a bit off.
Assessment: Suspects Migraine (fits headache, glare, photophobia/phonophobia). No signs of Cluster Headache.
Plan: Explanation: Migraine likely, not cluster headache. Read Thuisarts.nl for more info.
Medication: Start pain relief immediately at symptom onset.
Lifestyle/Monitoring: Keep headache diary (printed) for next few weeks. Identify worsening/improving factors (stress, coffee) and patterns.
Follow-up: Re-evaluation in 4 weeks with diary.
Safety Net: Return sooner if questions, worsening, or changing symptoms.
